Answers.Answer: A

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Question: What must you do when you come up to a red light showing at traffic signals?

Answers.Answer: Stop and then go on carefully
Go on slowly if no other traffic is coming
Stop only if other vehicles are coming from the right
Stop and wait until it changes to a green light

Question: When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic

Question: You are in the left-hand lane at traffic signals. You are waiting to turn left. At which of these traffic signals may you move on?

Answers.Answer: A
B
C
D

Question: Are you allowed to drive a vehicle with a load that is not tied on properly?

Answers.Answer: Yes – if you drive at less than 20km/h
Yes – if you put a white flag on the right-hand corner
Yes – if you think it will not come off the trailer
No – not at all

Question: Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system
Good sun visors and windscreen
An efficient carburettor and heater

Question: You are turning right at traffic signals showing a red arrow pointing to the right. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Drive on but give way to all oncoming vehicles
Stop and wait for a green arrow
Drive on straight ahead only if it is safe
Drive on because all oncoming vehicles are stopped

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: You must turn your headlights on when visibility is less than:

Answers.Answer: 100 metres
120 metres
140 metres
160 metres

Question: What should you do when you are coming up to traffic signals and the signals change from green to yellow?

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

Question: Before any modification is carried out on your vehicle, you should:

Answers.Answer: remove the registration plates from your vehicle
check with an authorised vehicle inspection centre
check that your warrant of fitness is current to within 1 month
record the modification on your vehicle ownership papers

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
You may park your vehicle for no longer than 40 minutes from 8am to 6pm on days other than public holidays
You may park your vehicle for longer than 40 minutes if someone stays in it
You may not park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: What does a white diamond painted on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: A pedestrian crossing ahead
Traffic signals ahead
A roundabout ahead
An intersection ahead

Question: Who can require you to undergo a breath screening test?

Answers.Answer: An ambulance officer
A doctor
A member of the public
A police officer

Question: What does a yellow reflector (cat's eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The centre of the road
No passing
The far right side of the road

Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:

Answers.Answer: in the countryside
picking up passengers
delivering packages
in a one-way street

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Answers.Answer: Yes
No

Question: When following a vehicle on a dusty metal (gravel) road, you should:

Answers.Answer: keep close to the other vehicles
drive down the centre of the road
adjust your speed to suit the conditions
pass the vehicle in front of you

Question: When passing a bus displaying a School sign, that has stopped to let children on or off, what should your speed be?

Answers.Answer: 20km/h
25km/h
30km/h
50km/h

Question: If you are a driver involved in a crash, what is the FIRST action you should take?

Answers.Answer: Stop and place a warning triangle at the side of the road
Drive past at 20km/h until you pass the site of the crash
Stop and check to see if anyone is hurt
Tell a police officer as soon as possible

No

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are following other vehicles
overtaking a vehicle
changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: You are driving downhill on a steep, narrow road and a vehicle is coming up the hill. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Pull over to the left and give way to the vehicle coming up the hill
Flash the headlights of your vehicle at the vehicle coming up the hill
Sound the horn of your vehicle to get the vehicle coming up the hill out of the way
Do nothing, the vehicle coming up the hill should give way to you

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: You may park your vehicle on a loading zone when:

Answers.Answer: you are loading or unloading people or goods
there is no other vehicle on it
it is between the hours of 12am and 6am
it is between the hours of 6pm and 6am

Question: When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Continue to drive the vehicle
Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Have the fault repaired immediately
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive slower than 50km/h
Do not drive faster than 50km/h unless the road is clear
Do not drive faster than 50km/h
There is a rest area 50 metres ahead

Question: The 100km/h speed limit sign shown is the minimum speed you are allowed to drive in good conditions.

Answers.Answer: True
False

Question: A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking
